decks.notes: The core idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while also maintaining board presence. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arid Mesa provide additional support and versatility, helping to control the game tempo and providing additional reach. The inclusion of Static Prison and Arena of Glory further enhances the deck's ability to maintain pressure and control the game flow.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach along with powerful artifacts like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to create a combo that can generate infinite mana and draw cards, ultimately winning the game by milling out the opponent or using Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help dig through the deck for combo pieces, while Mox Opal and Mox Amber provide fast mana acceleration. The deck is designed to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize Underworld Breach to continuously loop through your graveyard, using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Grinding Station to generate infinite mill and win conditions. By recurring artifacts and spells with Breach, you can eventually play Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Spell Snare to protect your combo, while cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming your opponent with a powerful, synergistic engine.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to create a powerful synergy that generates value and control over the game. By utilizing cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to boost its creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies. The inclusion of Eldrazi Temple, Urza's Saga, and Boseiju, Who Endures provides additional mana ramp and protection for the combo pieces. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around building a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a powerful combo.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and disrupt opponent's game plan. By using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, as well as creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude to deal with threats, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy. Cards like Relic of Progenitus also help in disrupting graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck focuses on keeping the opponent on the back foot while staying ahead on the board.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and controlling the board with a mix of creatures and counterspells. The deck includes powerful control cards such as Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, Counterspell, and Force of Negation to maintain control of the game. Additionally, cards like Subtlety and Murktide Regent provide strong threats that can end the game quickly if left unchecked. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and win through attrition and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan, while also gaining card advantage and filtering through the deck with spells like Consider and Prismatic Ending. The creatures in the deck provide additional value with abilities like card draw and creature removal. The deck also includes a mix of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal to control the board and protect against threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure a consistent flow of spells throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a win through superior control and resource management.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan while building up a board presence with efficient creatures. By using disruptive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Witch Enchanter, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Ephemerate, you aim to control the game and make it difficult for your opponent to execute their strategy. Additionally, cards like Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize help to further disrupt your opponent's plans while you establish your own threats on the battlefield.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and responding to threats effectively, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, then use Goryo's Vengeance to cheat those creatures into play for a surprise attack. Thoughtseize and Consign to Memory help control the opponent's hand and board while Fatal Push and Sink into Stupor provide removal options. Psychic Frog and Picklock Prankster offer additional value by disrupting the opponent's strategy. Faithless Looting allows for card selection and graveyard filling, making it easier to set up the combo. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with unexpected reanimated threats.
